sn38.1:4.1: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying in the Magadhan lands near the little village of Nālaka.
sn38.1:4.2: Then the wanderer Jambukhādaka went up to Venerable Sāriputta
sn38.1:4.4: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
sn38.1:5.1: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘extinguishment’.
sn38.1:5.3: “Reverend, the ending of greed, hate, and delusion
sn38.1:5.5: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for realizing this extinguishment?”
sn38.1:5.8: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
sn38.1:5.9: right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right samādhi.
sn38.1:5.10: This is the path, the practice, for realizing this extinguishment.”
sn38.1:5.11: “Reverend, this is a fine path, a fine practice, for realizing this extinguishment.
sn38.1:5.12: Just this much is enough to be diligent.”
